main event: A single, stationary white object was sighted directly overhead in Silver Springs, Maryland on September 3, 1956 and disappeared from sight in an upward direction.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3-5 minutes by a single civilian witness.
The object was described as between round and oval, metallic, and shiny.
The object moved steadily across the sky before disappearing straight up.
The weather conditions were clear with good visibility at the time of the sighting.
The preparing officer concluded that the evidence was not sufficient to pinpoint the light source.
